alert.note: Alert for Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 14 at 2:06PM MDT until April 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THROUGH 6 PM SATURDAY FOR THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Critical fire weather conditions will continue through mid evening across much of eastern New Mexico thanks to above normal temperatures, moderate to high Haines indices, very low humidity values and gusty westerly winds. Critical fire weather conditions will redevelop Saturday across the Sandia and Manzano Mountains as well as the Central Highlands. Strong northwest winds are expected to develop behind a cold front and though temperatures are not expected to be as high as today, dewpoints will lower considerably. Thus, several hours of single digit humidity values are expected on Saturday. Winds will decrease late in the afternoon to alleviate the critical fire weather concerns. However, widespread critical fire weather conditions are possible again mid week. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 6 PM MDT Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124) below significant snowpack Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 35 mph with occasional gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
